benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/tags - Retrieve bundle tags

covered: Valid Request: Multiple happy-path scenarios (no params, audit=FULL, audit=MINIMAL, includedDeleted=true, combinations) verify 200 responses and response body type.
Empty Response: Scenario for bundles with no tags verifies empty JSON array handling.
Query Parameters: Good coverage of audit and includedDeleted usage, unsupported audit value, extra/unexpected params, and injection attempts.
Error Scenarios: Invalid bundleId format (400) and non-existent bundle (404) are covered.
Authorization: Missing and invalid token cases (401) are included.
Reliability/Error Handling: API unavailable and slow dependency scenarios (503/504 or timeouts) are covered.
Performance/Scale: Tests for very large tag sets, concurrent requests, and resource utilization are present.
Regression: Specific regressions around deleted tags and backward compatibility (no audit param) are tested.
gaps: Pagination: No tests exercise pagination, limits, offset/page params or behaviour with very large datasets (e.g., ensuring paging or explicit "no pagination" behaviour).
Caching Behavior / HTTP Headers: No checks for caching-related headers (ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified) or conditional GET behaviour.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests for API rate limit responses (e.g., 429) or behavior under throttling.
Authorization granularity: 403 Forbidden / role/permission-based access scenarios are not covered (only 401 auth failures are tested).
Query param validation coverage: invalid values for includedDeleted (non-boolean) and boundary cases for audit (e.g., lowercase "full"/"minimal", repeated params) are missing.
Response schema / field-level validation: Tests assert "Tag objects" at a high level but do not validate required fields, types, or audit sub-structure in detail (beyond FULL/MINIMAL presence).
Content negotiation and headers: No tests for Accept header variations or verifying Content-Type negotiation other than one Content-Type check.
Error payload consistency: No assertions validating error response schema/structure for 4xx/5xx responses.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: verify behaviour when many tags exist (page size, offsets, next/prev links, limit defaults) and test boundary conditions (page 0, page beyond last).
Add caching/conditional GET tests: validate ETag and Cache-Control headers, conditional requests (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since) and expected 304 responses or cache invalidation behaviour.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate bursts to assert 429 responses or proper throttling headers and retry-after semantics.
Add authorization-permission tests: include 403 scenarios for authenticated but unauthorized clients and tests for role-based access if applicable.
Expand query-param validation tests: include invalid includedDeleted values (e.g., "yes", "1", "abc"), case sensitivity checks for audit enum, duplicate params and long/malformed query strings.
Add strict response-schema tests: validate each Tag object fields (ids, names, audit sub-objects), types, required/optional fields and examples for FULL/MINIMAL/NONE audit detail.
Validate error response schemas: assert consistent error code, message, and structure for 400/401/403/404/429/500 style responses.
Add content-negotiation tests: verify behavior with Accept: application/xml, missing Accept header, and explicit Content-Type checks across responses.
